prompt:
Patient Age: 72
Gender: male
Indication: abnormal CT chest findings
Diagnosis: D02.20
Procedures: Therapeutic Aspiration, EBUS-TBNA
Findings:
- Station 10R: Inadequate
- Station 7: Granulomas
- Secretions cleared from: Bilateral mainstems
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 07/14/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Brown

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 72-year-old male who presents with a abnormal CT chest findings.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D02.20 Carcinoma in situ of bronchus and lung.

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D02.20 Carcinoma in situ of bronchus and lung.

Positive for malignancy on ROSE (Negative/Inadequate).

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).
Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) lymph node sampling (2 nodes).

Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA).

Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE).

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS; Disposable Bronchoscope; 25-gauge and 22-gauge TBNA needles.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Bilateral mainstems from mucus.

EBUS Staging Indications: Diagnostic. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.
Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using 25-gauge Needle and 22-gauge Needle.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:


Station 10R (hilar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 4 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as not adequate and suggestive of blood and bronchial cells.
Final results are pending.


Station 7 (subcarinal): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 6 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomatous Inflammation.
Final results are pending.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

TBNA and TBNB station 10R.

TBNA and TBNB station 7.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

72-year-old male presenting for bronchoscopy for abnormal CT chest findings.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance.

EBUS-TBNA performed:


Station 10R: ROSE Inadequate.


Station 7: ROSE Granulomas.

Follow-up pathology results.

prompt: Please generate an operative report for a 64 year old male referred by Dr. Williams for hilar mass. We performed therapeutic aspiration of the Left Lower Lobe and Right Lower Lobe and EBUS TBNA of two stations. Station Station 10R was Negative and station Station 11L was Granulomas. Use diagnosis R91.1.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 07/02/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Williams

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 64-year-old male who presents with a hilar mass.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

R91.1 Solitary pulmonary nodule.

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

R91.1 Solitary pulmonary nodule.

Positive for malignancy on ROSE (Negative/Inadequate).

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).
Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) lymph node sampling (2 nodes).

Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA).

Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE).

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Left Lower Lobe and Right Lower Lobe from mucus.

EBUS Staging Indications: Diagnostic. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.
Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using 25-gauge Needle and 22-gauge Needle.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:


Station 10R (hilar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 8 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Lymphocytes / Negative for Malignancy.
Final results are pending.


Station 11L (interlobar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 4 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomatous Inflammation.
Final results are pending.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

TBNA and TBNB station 10R.

TBNA and TBNB station 11L.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance.

EBUS-TBNA performed:


Station 10R: ROSE Negative.


Station 11L: ROSE Granulomas.

Follow-up pathology results.

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).
Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) lymph node sampling (2 nodes).

Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA).

Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE).

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS; Disposable Bronchoscope; 25-gauge and 22-gauge TBNA needles.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Upper Lobe and Bronchus Intermedius from mucus.

EBUS Staging Indications: Diagnostic. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.
Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using 25-gauge Needle and 22-gauge Needle.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:


Station 11L (interlobar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 4 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Small Cell Carcinoma.
Final results are pending.


Station 11Rs (superior hilar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 8 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomatous Inflammation.
Final results are pending.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

TBNA and TBNB station 11L.

TBNA and TBNB station 11Rs.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

73-year-old female presenting for bronchoscopy for hilar mass.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance.

EBUS-TBNA performed:


Station 11L: ROSE Small Cell.


Station 11Rs: ROSE Granulomas.

Follow-up pathology results.

prompt: Please generate an operative report for a 76 year old female referred by Dr. Brown for hilar mass. We performed therapeutic aspiration of the Right Upper Lobe and Bronchus Intermedius and EBUS TBNA of two stations. Station Station 4L was Inadequate and station Station 10R was Adeno. Use diagnosis R91.1.

The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 6 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Positive for malignancy.
Final results are pending.


Station 7 (subcarinal): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 6 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Positive for malignancy.
Final results are pending.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

TBNA and TBNB station 11Rs.

TBNA and TBNB station 7.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

63-year-old male presenting for bronchoscopy for hilar mass.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance.

EBUS-TBNA performed:


Station 11Rs: ROSE Positive.


Station 7: ROSE Positive.

prompt: Procedure: Bronchoscopy with EBUS/TBNA. Indication: mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Dx: D02.20. Patient: 75 M. Samples: Station 11Rs (Negative) and Station 4L (Negative). Aspiration performed for secretions.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 12/28/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Johnson

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 75-year-old male who presents with a mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D02.20 Carcinoma in situ of bronchus and lung.

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

D02.20 Carcinoma in situ of bronchus and lung.

Positive for malignancy on ROSE (Negative/Inadequate).

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode).
Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) lymph node sampling (2 nodes).

Transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA).

Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE).

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS; Disposable Bronchoscope; 25-gauge and 22-gauge TBNA needles.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None.

COMPLICATIONS None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection & Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.

EBUS Staging Indications: Diagnostic. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Only those 5 mm or greater in short axis were sampled.
Lymph node sizing was performed by EBUS and sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using 25-gauge Needle and 22-gauge Needle.

Lymph Nodes Evaluated:


Station 11Rs (superior hilar): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 4 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Anthracotic Pigment / Negative for Malignancy.
Final results are pending.


Station 4L (lower paratracheal): The lymph node was ≥ 10 mm on CT (Metabolic activity unknown).
The lymph node was photographed and sampled. 8 endobronchial ultrasound guided transbronchial biopsies were performed.
ROSE Results: Preliminary ROSE Cytology was reported as adequate and suggestive of Anthracotic Pigment / Negative for Malignancy.
Final results are pending.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

TBNA and TBNB station 11Rs.

TBNA and TBNB station 4L.

IMPRESSION/PLAN

75-year-old male presenting for bronchoscopy for mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus clearance.

EBUS-TBNA performed:


Station 11Rs: ROSE Negative.


Station 4L: ROSE Negative.

Follow-up pathology results.
